title: India's tragic bridge collapse takes a political turn
description: After at least 141 people died in the accident, the company in charge of renovating the structure is accused of numerous acts of negligence.

title: Musk fires Twitter board of directors, makes himself sole member
description: Twitter's new owner Elon Musk dissolved the board of directors on Monday and is also reportedly planning major job cuts.

title: The Chechen battalion fighting 'against Russian imperialism' in Ukraine
description: Under Ukrainian command, the Dzhokhar-Dudayev battalion is confronting the Russian army in the Donbas, with the aim of weakening Moscow and the hope of reviving Ichkeria, the independent Chechnya.

title: 'Break her kneecaps': Pelosi suspect planned to hold House Speaker hostage
description: David DePape told police on Monday he wanted to attack the American politician when he broke into her home on Friday.

title: Instagram bug tells users accounts are suspended
description: The social media site said that it was working to reconnect users who were seemingly locked out of their accounts.

title: Emmanuel Macron specifies his plan to improve the fight against fires: new Canadair, drones, financial means...
description: The French president's response to the intense fires over the summer combines both preventative measures and measures to support firefighters.

title: Star French gymnast De Jesus Dos Santos follows in Simone Biles' footsteps
description: After the 2021 Tokyo Olympic Games, four-time European champion Mélanie De Jesus Dos Santos decided to leave France to train in Texas. She is competing in the World Championships in Liverpool, with Paris 2024 in her sights.

title: Iran to hold mass trials for arrested protestors
description: Authorities announced that about 1,000 people in Tehran would face open mass trials for their role in the protests that are sweeping the country.

title: US midterms: A close New York gubernatorial race puts Democrats on the defensive
description: Anxious New York Democrats closely watching the race between incumbent Governor Kathy Hochul and her Republican opponent Lee Zeldin amid clashes over crime.

title: Al-Shabab exacts bloody revenge in Mogadishu
description: The twin attack that claimed more than 100 victims in the Somali capital on Saturday has been attributed to the jihadist group, which has stepped up its attacks since the summer in retaliation for military operations by the authorities.

title: Paul Pogba will miss World Cup with injury
description: The French midfielder was facing a race against the clock to recover from his knee injury.

title: Mike Davis, prophetic US writer and activist, dies at 76
description: The author, dubbed California's 'prophet of doom,' wrote over a dozen books, including 'City of Quartz: Excavating the Future of Los Angeles', a classic of urban sociology.

title: France orders safety checks for motorbikes, overturning government decision
description: The French court overturned a government directive to forget about the measures that it said 'overstepped its powers.'

title: Paris Masters tennis tournament: 'We come to see hard rock!'
description: Once again this year, the Accor Arena will host the final round of the men's tennis circuit. With its electric atmosphere, the Paris indoor venue differs from the center court of Roland-Garros.

title: Amid bird flu outbreak, England orders all poultry to be kept indoors
description: The government's housing order comes amid the nation's largest-ever outbreak of avian influenza.

title: UK home secretary Braverman admits to more email lapses
description: Suella Braverman used her personal phone for government documents a total of six times. The revelations come as she is under increased scrutiny for her hardline immigration policies.

title: In a state of mourning, South Korea begins asking questions about the 'Halloween nightmare'
description: There were no crowd control measures in the Seoul district where 154 people died on Saturday night, with only 137 police officers deployed.

title: 'Macron slipped into Sarkozy's language: The same words, clichés and obsessions'
description: In his interview on France 2 television last Wednesday, the president drew heavily on his predecessor's vocabulary. This was no accident.

title: Former French justice minister Michel Mercier tried for misappropriation of public funds
description: The former centrist senator is appearing in court along with his wife and daughter, whom he is suspected of having fraudulently employed.

title: Nice attack trial: The attempt to understand a 'monster'
description: Last week in the trial was dedicated to trying to understand the terrorist's personality. But all the descriptions failed to uncover the deep motivations for his senseless crime.

title: Bolsonaro ally wins key Sao Paulo gubernatorial election
description: Tarcisio de Freitas, one of the outgoing president's supporters, has become governor of Brazil's richest state, Sao Paulo.

title: Ukraine grain exports resume despite Russia's withdrawal from deal
description: Ships brought grain from Ukrainian ports on Monday, as Turkey fights to save the agreement to avoid a global food crisis.

title: No prospect of collective agreement for Air France flight attendants
description: Negotiations between company management and flight attendant representatives were supposed to be concluded on October 31, but have stalled over the issue of staffing levels.

title: 'The nightmare is over': Lula supporters rejoice throughout Brazil
description: The left-wing candidate won 50.9% of the vote against incumbent Jair Bolsonaro after a tense election day.

title: Ons Jabeur: Tennis champion and Tunisia's 'minister for happiness'
description: The current world number two, who will play in the highly elite Masters in the US from October 31, has put Tunisia on the tennis map. The player has become a role model for young people in her country.

title: Brazil elects Lula: A global sigh of relief
description: Lula's narrow victory over Jair Bolsonaro reveals how immense the task is, so much of Bolsonaro's party and even ideology is now firmly anchored in Congress as well as in many states in the South American behemoth.

title: Russian barrage hits Kyiv and critical infrastructure around Ukraine
description: Kyiv's mayor said 80% of the capital's residents have their water supply cut off.

title: French government condemns 'eco-terrorism' at water protests
description: Activists clashed with police as they demonstrated against the construction of a network of water reserves for agricultural irrigation in western France. The interior minister slammed them as 'eco-terrorists.'

title: Israeli Arabs could be kingmakers in election, but turnout is key
description: In Israel's fifth election in four years, many voters from the country's Arab minority – 20% of the population – are unsure of turning up.

title: 26 stories of swine: World's largest pig farm opens in China
description: For the past two years, mega pig farms have been on the rise, encouraged by the Chinese government, which aims to achieve food autonomy for the country.

title: China launches third and final module for Tiangong space station
description: China, which was banned from the International Space Station in 2011, is set to finish assembling its own space station which will be manned by three astronauts.

title: From prison to Brazilian president: Lula's spectacular comeback but underwhelming victory
description: On his release from prison, Lula said he wanted to 'save' Brazil from Jair Bolsonaro's 'hate project.' The rescue plan proved more complicated than expected, and the newly elected president inherits a divided country.

title: Belgium overwhelmed by new influx of asylum seekers
description: The reception structures are saturated, forcing many migrants to spend the night on the street.

title: In Denmark, uncertain legislative elections in a context of health crisis
description: Fourteen parties are competing in the November 1 election. The favorite, Social Democrat Mette Frederiksen, could be challenged for the prime minister's post by her former opponent, Lars Lokke Rasmussen.

title: 'In the UK, there are two financial worlds that do not defend the same political interests'
description: While Liz Truss' libertarian program was backed by alternative investment funds, 'mainstream' bankers are now coming back to the forefront with Rishi Sunak, explains the political science researcher Marlene Benquet in 'Le Monde.'

title: Doubts persist over the origin of human remains returned by France to Algeria
description: Of the 24 19th-century Algerian skulls handed over by France in July 2020, only six were identified as those of real resistance fighters. The case illustrates the complexity of this thorny memory issue.

title: Death toll from Philippine storm rises to 98
description: Just over half of the fatalities were from a series of flash floods and landslides that destroyed villages on the southern island of Mindanao on Friday.

title: José Martinez, new director of dance at the Opéra de Paris
description: The 53-year-old Spanish dancer succeeds Aurélie Dupont, who left her position on July 31.
